author: Scott Ellis
title: Stay tuned: The verdict on Karl Stefanovic's future is nigh
text:
The Verdict panel and its host Karl Stefanovic. Photo: Nine 
Despite rumours Karl Stefanovic is contemplating his television future, the Nine network has confirmed The Verdict , his prime-time panel show, is to be extended .
News reports at the weekend claimed Stefanovic, who has hosted Nine's Today  for 11 years, reported for 60 Minutes on a regular basis and is now fronting The Verdict , was exhausted by the workload and looking for a change.
Those supposedly close to the star were quoted as saying the early morning workload was too much, hinted at a strained relationship with his Today co-host Lisa Wilkinson (unlikely according to those close to the pair), and said it was believed Stefanovic was looking for a regular prime-time television job.
Karl Stefanovic on the Today set with Lisa Wilkinson. Photo: Channel Nine 
Stefanovic himself was quoted by News Corporation papers as saying he wanted to do more "news-based stuff".
Advertisement "A late show would be tremendous fun, something more entertainment focused, not like The Verdict," he told Brisbane's The Sunday Mail .
Tellingly, however, it is believed the gold Logie winner is currently in negotiations with Nine management to renew his contract, with some media analysts dismissing the speculation as predictable given the time of year.
"Meanwhile the annual rumour that Karl Stefanovic is looking to move on from  Today  is back," reported television news portal TV Tonight . "One day it will be right."
Similarly a Nine source dismissed the stories, but did confirm at least one aspect of Stefanovic's work life was secure:  The Verdict .
"Among the annual end of year Karl rumours, what is true is that we're sticking with him and commissioning more weeks of The Verdict," a source said.
Originally intended to be a five-week run, The Verdict will now continue until the end of the ratings year (the end of November), for a total of eight episodes.
Others at Nine said while anything was possible in the television world ("Someone could always make an incredible offer that we couldn't match"), it was most likely Stefanovic would remain a Nine celebrity.
"The (contract) negotiations are amicable, there's no pressure from anyone, and it's likely there will be an announcement about Karl's future with Nine before the end of the ratings year," one insider said.
